alert.note: Alert for Burleigh; Morton (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 02 at 1:34PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...MISSOURI RIVER NEAR BISMARCK AND MANDAN ICING OVER... While ice has been making its way through the Bismarck and Mandan reach of the Missouri the past few days, data for the Missouri River gages at Bismarck, Below Mandan, and Schmidt Bottoms all reflect a steady rise over the past 24 hours of nearly one foot. This is somewhat slower than normal even though it is likely to accelerate through Friday afternoon and evening as the river channel fills with immobile ice. Since 2010, the river has risen between five and nearly eight feet during the first icing over event for the winter season, often in well under 24 hours. As of Friday afternoon, the water level for the Missouri River at Bismarck is 4.9 feet. Given recent history, this would suggest the river will be at a stage of between roughly 9 feet and 12 feet once the river ice is in place. Flood stage at the Bismarck gage on the Missouri River is 14.5 feet. If you observe problematic high water, please report this to your local emergency management.
